subject: History
title: The French Revolution's Terror
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The French Revolution's Terror.

hook.text: The French Revolution promised liberty and equality. Then it invented the guillotine and killed 17,000 people.

buildup.text: In 1789, the Bastille fell. Feudalism was abolished. The Declaration of the Rights of Man inspired the world.

discovery.text: But radicals seized power. Robespierre's Committee of Public Safety executed 'enemies of the revolution' daily.

twist.text: Robespierre himself was guillotined in 1794. The revolution devoured its own creators.

climax.text: The chaos paved the way for Napoleonâ€”a military dictator. The revolution against tyranny ended in tyranny.

punchline.text: The revolution ate its children, then crowned a new king.

quiz.question: What ultimately happened to Robespierre, leader of the Reign of Terror?
options: He was guillotined by his own colleagues
He fled to Britain and lived in exile
